discussion.content: D should be the correct answer as All the three are features of RODC

questions.question_text:
RODC comes with a number of features that focus on heightened security with limited functionality to remote office users. Which of the following are features of
RODC?

questions.answer_description: Set the static VNet IP address information to a VM object.
questions.question_text:
Your network contains an active directory domain named contoso.com. The domain consists of 20 member Servers and 5 domain controllers. All servers run
Windows Server 2012 R2. The domain contains 500 client computers.
You plan to deploy a domain controller for contoso.com in Microsoft Azure.
You need to prepare the conversation for planned deployment. The solution should ensure that the domain controller hosted in Azure always have the same IP address.
Witch two actions should you perform? Each correct answer is a part of the solution.

choices.D: From an domain controller run the Set-NetIPAdresses cmdlet
choices.C: From Azure virtual machine run the Set –NetIPAuthentication cmdlet
choices.A: From an Azure virtual machine run the Set-AzureStaticVNetIP cmdlet
choices.B: Deploy a Side by side virtual private network (VPN)
choices.E: From an domain controller run adprep.exe

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
Your network contains one Active Directory forest named contoso.com. The forest contains a single domain. All domain controllers run Windows Server 2012 R2.
The domain contains an organizational unit (OU) named TemporaryUsers that only contains 50 user accounts for temporary employees. The users are members of a global group named TempUsers.
The TemporaryUsers OU is configured as shown in the exhibit. (Click the exhibit button.)
//IMG//

You need to delete all of the user accounts of the temporary employees.
What Windows PowerShell command should you run? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
Hot Area:

HOTSPOT -
You have a Hyper-V host named Host1 that runs Windows Server 2012. All of the virtual machines on Host1 use VHDs.
You install the Hyper-V server role on a server named Host2 that runs Windows Server 2012 R2. Host2 has the same hardware configurations as Host11.
You plan to migrate the Hyper-V host from Host1 to Host2 by using the Windows Server Migration Tools.
In the table below, identify what can be migrated by using the Windows Server Migration Tools. Note: Make only one selection in each row. Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:

choices.B: Run the Export-DhcpServer cmdlet and specify the Leases parameter.
choices.D: Run the Add-DhcpServer4Lease cmdlet and specify the ""hostname parameter. B
choices.A: Run the Get-DhcpServerv4Lease cmdlet and specify the ""AllLeases parameter.
choices.C: Run the Send-SmigServerData cmdlet and specify the ""computername cmdlet.

questions.question_text:
Your network contains an Active Directory domain named contoso.com. The domain contains computers that use IPv4 and IPv6.
You have a DHCP server named Server1 that runs Windows Server 2012.
You install Windows Server 2012 R2 on a server named Server2. You install the DHCP Server server role on
Server2.
You need to migrate the DHCP services from Server1 to Server2. The solution must meet the following requirements:
✑ Ensure that existing leases are migrated.
✑ Prevent lease conflicts.
Which cmdlet should you use to retrieve the required information from Server1?

discussion.content: My bad. This question has nothing to do with export but just say, "Which cmdlet should you use to retrieve the required information from Server1?" So A is most appropriate. Thanks
B. Run the Export-DhcpServer cmdlet and specify the Leases parameter.
